Articles.Content: Can you use both the ORDA and Erkle docking plugins, or just one of them?
Just now getting a chance to fire up the new Angara toys. Holy crap man. +rep for you.

Don't know if this is a touchy subject or not, but On the VA, the lower decoupler, does it actually decouple, or is that functionality to-be-added at a later date? I installed the plugins in the VA pack as well as the VA parts into the parts folder. As far as I can tell, it's not my fault.

Also, on the top boosters, they engage like they should, but when they are spent, the sound and particle system doesn't stop for two of the boosters. When the nose separates, it doesn't start flipping or anything as if there were thrust, it just separates like it should. I pretty much did a LES testing rocket, and found this problem. I don't have the particle effects in the VAB for some of the other engines, so like I said, the plugins are installed correctly.

I'm having precisely the same problems. I don't know how to decouple the decoupler. Animation starts at some odd moment, since the "clamp" on VA's back is detached when I try to decouple it, but the decoupler itself stays attached no matter what I do. The engine thing also happens to me.
I'm having trouble with the LK lander parts. (for example, the fuel tanks) I can't get them to attach evenly, is there a .craft file or tutorial on how to build the LK lander?
where did you get those black cylindrical parts and the extra command modules?

Okay, so, managed to get the VA to work. What I did was make a new fresh KSP install, and then put the VA in there first. The decoupler worked, however the two rockets not shutting off is still a problem. I installed all of my mods, and the decoupler still works. So, I have no idea what happened.
here's my problem:
Have you tried to attach them individually?

yeah Fixed the VA engine problem but i cnanot update kerbal.net lol.

I will get to fixing the LK attach problem soon.

Can you use both the ORDA and Erkle docking plugins, or just one of them?

I'd really love to know which of these two are recommended.

I'd really love to know which of these two are recommended.

You can try both and decide for yourself:

- ORDA has the most sophisticated autopilot that can pretty much rendez-vous and dock on it's own. However, the docking is fragile for the moment. There is a better version in the works.

- Erkle requires that you rendez-vous and dock manually, and pulls you in like a magnet on the last few meters. The docking is more solid, but still sometimes undocks you if you warp for too long.

You can have both on your ship. You can use the ORDA computer to stabilize the target ship and dock with Erkle.
having personally flown the new ORDA pre-release. I strongly recommend getting used to ORDA.

I like your mod and artwork. But this time I had a really tough time with it because your Engines were wobbly as hell and I couldn't get a Rocket working good.

And finally I found out what was the issue:

You have made a tiny mistake on your big vectored engines.

I the part.cfg you have writen:

gymbalRange = 0.5 instead of gimbalRange = 0.5

Thats why ingame is written Gimbal Range = 2.5 and every roket is wobly as hell at least for me.
yeah should be fixed in next version. fixed that some time ago.

also, your rockets seen to be a bit too top heavy, I can barely get one into orbit. I cannot control where the rocket goes, even with the high gimbalrange.

sorry for being a pest! just being a good test pilot

I haven't had as much fun since Legos.

Also -- It's a pretty awesome coincidence that your stuff looks great on mine. I can see a whole relay network coming up with 1/3 Kosmos parts in the near future...
Really looking forward to the next SSPP pack

Really looking forward to the next SSPP pack
